source.name: Fungible Token Use Cases
source.instructions: Which of the following scenarios represent suitable use cases for fungible tokens? Select all that apply.

answers.answer: Tokenizing shares of a company's stock
Creating a unique digital collectible card
Representing carbon credits in a sustainability initiative
Implementing an in-game currency for a blockchain-based game
Tokenizing ownership of a specific piece of real estate

source.guidance: This question assesses understanding of fungible token use cases. Fungible tokens are suitable for assets that are divisible and interchangeable, such as company stocks, carbon credits, and in-game currencies. These can be easily divided and exchanged without losing value. Unique digital collectibles and specific real estate properties are non-fungible, as each item is distinct and not interchangeable, making them unsuitable for fungible tokenization. Understanding these distinctions is crucial for choosing the appropriate token type in blockchain applications.
source.learningObjectives: SWBAT identify and evaluate appropriate use cases for fungible tokens in blockchain applications
